topics.body:
"@CogWeaver":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5393f8806368725390700400#post_5393f8806368725390700400

topics.author: 50b70eeb7f123b1a02000097

topics.body:
"@Randomosaur":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5393f8bc6368727d91750100#post_5393f8bc6368727d91750100
It was mostly because I was expecting actual cake underneath all that icing.  It was still tasty, as most people find watermelons tasty, but if you're expecting cake and not really craving watermelon at that moment? _HUGE_ disappointment.

Also, icing and watermelon doesn't mix too well, so unless you scrape that off you lose a bunch of the watermelon's taste through over-sweetening
topics.author: 4fde0c7e945b706cc30003eb

Ah, well the one I had was covered in white frosting with sprinkles on it.  Dunno how cream would taste.
But if you legitimately thought it was cake underneath and not watermelon, you're still going to be in for a pretty big disappointment.
